snippet: The carmaker, which expects to make $9.7 billion for the full year through March, has been less exposed than its Japanese peers to the fallout over a territorial dispute with China.
abstract: Toyota expects to make $9.7 billion profit for the full fiscal year through March 2013; it has been less exposed than its Japanese peers to the fallout over territorial dispute with China; reports second-quarter profit of 257.9 billion yen ($3.2 billion), compared with 80.4 billion yen in year-ago quarter.
lead_paragraph: The carmaker, which expects to make $9.7 billion for the full year through March, has been less exposed than its Japanese peers to the fallout over a territorial dispute with China.

headline.main: Toyota Raises Forecast Despite Lag in China
headline.print_headline: Toyota Raises Forecast Despite Lag in China
